page.title: 09THE PARK INFORMATION CENTRE
page.content: With the development of the area as a 'tourist resort',an information centre was opened by the National Park's at Ingram.Here they have booklets on this and other areas of Northumberland.There are also several displays of things such as landscapes,animal skulls,animal footprints,wild animals and the valley in ancient times.You can also buy the usual souvenirs.Opposite the centre is St Michael's Church.There is a small car-park. The information centre is attached to what was the wardens house .There are now plans to move the centre closer to the road which serves the valley.This move is at present being opposed by the locals.
